magazine.translation[0].definitions[0].d: a large thin book with a paper cover that contains news stories, articles, photographs etc, and is sold weekly or monthly
magazine.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She glanced over the magazine racks.
She’s the editor of a popular women’s magazine.
magazine.translation[0].definitions[1].d: a television or radio programme which is made up of a number of reports
magazine.translation[0].definitions[2].d: the part of a gun that holds the bullets
magazine.translation[0].definitions[3].d: the part that holds the film in a camera or projector
magazine.translation[0].definitions[4].d: a room or building for storing weapons, explosives etc
magazine.translation[0].note_box[0].item: You read or see something in a magazine
He read an interview with her in a magazine
He read an interview with her on a magazine
magazine.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a large thin book containing news, articles, photographs etc which is produced weekly or monthly
magazine.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The magazine has a weekly circulation (=the number of copies sold) of four million.
